result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terry Wayne Mccann Jr

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on November 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:02 AM 
Defendant Terry Wayne Mccann Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Eric Sheets in court for Terry Wayne Mccann Jr.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin.
ADA Dodge calls the case and states appearances.
Matter set for a bond modification hearing.
Atty sheets makes arguments in favor of a reduction of the cash bond previously set.
ADA Dodge makes comments and requests that the court deny the motion to modify bond.
Court questions ADA Dodge.
Atty Sheets makes statements in response to ADA Dodge.

Court makes statements regarding the factors the court is to consider regarding bond.

BY THE COURT:
Motion to modify bond is denied.

If there are significant changes to plans regarding treatment for the defendant, the court may consider modifying bond.

Court questions parties regarding a pre-trial conference.
Waiver of Right to Personal Appearance filed by Atty Eric Sheets
Motion hearing on October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond filed by Atty Eric Sheets (sent to Br 1 Judge/JA on 10/14/22 sp)
filed by Atty Eric Sheets

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
matter set for ptc 10/24/22 at 10:00
Defendant's Waiver of Preliminary Examination filed by Atty Eric Sheets

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:13 PM Defendant Terry Wayne Mccann Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Eric Sheets in court for Terry Wayne Mccann Jr.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Sheets provides the Court with a written waiver of preliminary hearing.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:19 PM Defendant Terry Wayne Mccann Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Eric Sheets in court for Terry Wayne Mccann Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney does not waive time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present. 
State request bond to be amended.
BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney /s/ MDZ 08/30/22
Atty Eric Sheets appointed

1:37 PM Defendant Terry Wayne Mccann Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

ADA Dodge calls the case and states the appearances.
Court has approved the defendant's request for a court appointed attorney.
No attorney has been appointed as of today's date.
Court would request an adjournment.

BY THE COURT: 
Case is adjourned. 
Bond continued
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Letter from the Defendant in re:  request for bail reduction hearing
sent to Br 1 Judge/JA on 08/22/22 sp

10:01 a.m.   Defendant Terry Wayne Mccann Jr in court, in custody.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

ADA Dodge calls the case and states the appearances.
Set for Bond Modification and Indigency Hearing.
Court questions the defendant as to why he had been denied by the public defenders office.
Defendant responds.
Court pulls up the defendant's petition for court appointed attorney.
10:03 a.m.  Defendant is sworn in.
Court questions the defendant.
Defendant states that he has his divorce hearing set for 08/22/22.
Court indicates that his hearing may be premature but after the divorce hearing, which is set for 08/22/22 he may not get anything and would then be eligible for a public defender.
ADA Dodge states that the stipulated divorce has been moved to December.
Court now moves ahead with the petition for court appointed attorney.
Defendant needs to provide the court with the State Public Defender Eligibility Evaluation Form and additional document.

Court moves on to the bond modification.
Defendant is not sure what he had put in the letter.
Court reads the letter to the defendant.
Court questions victim notification.
10:13 a.m.  State has complied with victim notification statutes and the victim has written letter and this is read by Legal Assistant, R.O.
ADA Dodge adds an additional statement with regards to the bond modification requested by the defendant.
ADA Dodge would ask that the bond be DENIED.

BY THE COURT:
Defendant to provide the documents as stated on the record to the Court.
Bond Modification is DENIED.
Bond is continued.
Indigency hearing on August 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:26 PM Defendant Terry Wayne Mccann Jr appeared by video, in custody. Prosecuting attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Matter is rescheduled to allow time to get a court appointed attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
filed by the State

1:36 PM Defendant Terry Wayne Mccann Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant appears without counsel.
Court questions the defendant if he has spoken with the public defender.
Defendant states that he was denied a state public defender.
Court appointed paperwork had been filed with Branch 1.
Judge Zell informs the defendant he will make his decision on a court appointed attorney within the week.

BY THE COURT:
Adjourned Initial Appearance set
Bond is continued
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

11:03 AM Defendant Terry W MCCann appeared by video.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of WI.  Atty Taylor Soule appears on behalf of the defendant.

ADA Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of  Terrorist Threats, Stalking, Misdemeanor Bail Jumping and possible additional charges.
PBT .258
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant is informed to complete the petition for appointment of a court appointed attorney and send to the Courts.
Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $20,000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule objects to the cash bond and would request a signature bond and states her reasons on the record.
Court will set the $20,000 cash bond with conditions as stated on the record.
Defendant has low ties to the community
Hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
